newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares end up on A share gains.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares end up on A share gains.

text.p: Shanghai B shares ended sharply up on Monday as local investors spilled over from the active domestic A share market, pushing volume significantly higher than last Friday brokers said.
The B index surged 3.178 points or 3.66 percent to 90.045 on volume of 20.75 million shares worth $14.593 million.
The A index soared 53.477 points or 3.99 percent to 1,395.339 points on turnover of 8.46 billion yuan.
Brokers said a good performance on the A share market encouraged domestic investors to buy blue-chip B shares.
"Institutions were active, which boosted follow-up buying and made the market move up late in the session," one broker said.

"There are signs that the market has started another run-up after consolidating around 87 points for some time," another broker said. "The B share market will see 100 points this time if there is no major negative news in sight in the near future."
Forty-two of the 43 B share issues traded, with 28 of them up, 11 down and three unchanged.
Shanghai Dazhong Taxi was the star after the firm's shareholders approved a 10-for-10 bonus issue, surging $0.168 or 10.00 percent to $1.848 on volume of 586,700 shares.

Pudong real estate Shanghai Jinqiao Export Processing Zone Development was the most actively traded issue. Aided by institutional buying, it rose $0.050, or 6.94 percent, to $0.770 on volume of 2.2 million shares.
Shanghai's A share index surged after a recent consolidation, helped by a lack of any new government measures to curb market speculation, brokers said.

Domestic investors had been cautious on fears that market regulators would announce further measures to those already in place to cool what they see as an overheated market. A sharply expanded quota for new issues and an increase in the stock transaction duty were among the measures taken recently.
The SSE30 blue chip index climbed 126.967 points, or 3.21 percent, to 4,080.126 points.
Yunnan Baoshan Cement was the star performer on institutional speculative buying, surging 0.72 yuan or 10.06 percent to 7.87 yuan on volume of 738,600 shares.
